scene.name: intro
scene.line: `(To JUNEBUG.)` Really?
You were entranced! You don't remember this?
It's OK. We've all seen a lot of concerts.
Cyrano opened. His tape machine was broken or something; it got really `cosmic`.
Right, at the flower shop. I remember `that` show, I just ... sorry, Clara.
Well, you have a second chance to hear it tonight.
`(To EZRA.)` That was fast. Got the batteries?
Let's see ... perfect, this one will do! So, you hit this button `here` to record. Hold it right `here` so you don't cover the microphone with your hand.

I bet you'll find a lot of good sounds just around the tugboat. There's plenty of tape in there, so don't be stingy with it! Just record anything that catches your ear. It really changes the way you `listen` ... for the better, I mean.
scene.option: `(To CLARA.)` Are you playing a concert tonight? I could record that.

scene.name: concert
scene.line: Yeah, Clara here came all the way from Lithuania just to do this Echo River gig!
Ha ha. It's a tour. Tomorrow, I'll be in Nashville, and then Atlanta, and then over to the coast.
Brutal. Well, we're lucky she's making a stop. Johnny and I saw her play once, and `I` remember loving it. And Johnny was `moved`.
Speaking of Cyrano, it's his night at The Rum Colony. Cate said she usually stops off there.

scene.name: destination
scene.line: We've got a ways to go, and this boat makes pretty frequent stops. I think Cate said we're moving pretty slowly tonight, too. Weather.
Cate said we could stop at The Rum Colony. Cyrano's playing.

scene.name: rum-colony
scene.line: Well, that's ideal â€” I'm supposed to meet a lady there to look at some old engine parts, about ... three hours ago.
Three hours goes fast at The Rum Colony, ma'am. I bet she's still there.
I hope we don't stop there `too` long. My concert is soon, I don't want to keep them waiting.
Naw, it's "river time." Nobody expects you to be punctual.
`(To EZRA.)` Hey, why don't you give that tape recorder a try? See if that cat over there has anything he wants to say.
I often use "found sounds" in my music. If you find some interesting sounds tonight, you can help me out!
